snippet: Problems at a Jackson, Miss., unit will be among the topics discussed at a special field hearing of the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs in Pittsburgh on Monday.
abstract: Investigation by Veterans Affairs Department finds that one of its hospitals in Jackson, Miss, did not have enough doctors in its primary care unit, resulting in nurse practitioners’ handling far too many patients, numerous complaints about delayed care and repeated violations of federal rules on prescribing narcotics.
lead_paragraph: Problems at a Jackson, Miss., unit will be among the topics discussed at a special field hearing of the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs in Pittsburgh on Monday.

headline.main: Inquiry Finds Inadequate Staffing at Mississippi Veterans Hospital
headline.print_headline: V.A. Inquiry Finds Inadequate Staffing of Doctors at Mississippi Hospital

keywords.value: Montgomery, G V (Sonny), Veteran Affairs Medical Center
